text: The National Federation of Democratic Women (NFDW) is the official organization of the Democratic Party that focuses on women's issues. The NFDW was established in 1971 as a means of supporting women's voices within the Democratic Party of the United States. The NFDW hosts national and state-level conferences and activities. The NFDW is a recognized constituent group of the Democratic National Committee. == References == Category:Democratic Party (United States) Category:Organizations
title: National Federation of Democratic Women
